headline.main: Coke Spends Lavishly on Pediatricians and Dietitians
headline.print_headline: In Obesity Debate, Coke Spends Lavishly

docs.abstract: A soft-drink company’s philanthropy wins it praise despite its sugary contribution to obesity in America.
docs.snippet: A soft-drink company’s philanthropy wins it praise despite its sugary contribution to obesity in America.

docs.lead_paragraph: It’s simple: All Ashkenazi Jewish women should have the BRCA test.

headline.main: The Breast Cancer Gene and Me
headline.print_headline: The Breast Cancer Gene and Me

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Elizabeth Wurtzel reflects on how she was blindsided by being diagnosed with breast cancer; notes she has BRCA mutation, as do many of her fellow Ashkenazi Jews, and notes that most insurers do not pay for screening for mutation unless patient meets specific requirements; calls on insurers to cover BRCA testing for all Ashkenazi Jewish women, given their increased risk.
docs.snippet: It’s simple: All Ashkenazi Jewish women should have the BRCA test.

docs.lead_paragraph: PAUL--William E.,MD The SUNY Downstate Medical Center community mourns the passing of William E. Paul, MD, chief of the Laboratory of Immunology, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, and former director of the National Institutes of Health Office of AIDS Research. An internationally acclaimed researcher, Dr. Paul was a 1960 graduate of SUNY Downstate's College of Medicine, and a recipient of a SUNY honorary Doctor of Science degree and a Distinguished Alumni Award. Dr. Paul's contributions to medicine, science, and public health will be long remembered. We extend our deepest sympathies to his family, colleagues, and friends. Carlos N. Pato, MD Dean, College of Medicine John F. Williams, MD, EdD, MPH President 1/3

docs.lead_paragraph: IBM will announce Watson’s new abilities, but it hopes to open the system up to software developers, highlighting start-ups.

headline.main: IBM’s A.I. System Watson to Get Second Home, on West Coast
headline.print_headline: A Second Home for IBM’s Watson, in Silicon Valley

docs.abstract: IBM plans to open second headquarters for Watson, its artificial-intelligence system, in San Francisco in 2016; currently has headquarters in downtown Manhattan; division is also set to announce new capabilities in Watson services like speech, language understanding, image recognition and sentiment analysis.
docs.snippet: IBM will announce Watson’s new abilities, but it hopes to open the system up to software developers, highlighting start-ups.

docs.lead_paragraph:
PAUL--William E., MD

The SUNY Downstate Medical Center community mourns the passing of William E. Paul, MD, chief of the Laboratory of Immunology, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, and former director of the National Institutes of Health Office of AIDS Research. An internationally acclaimed researcher, Dr. Paul was a 1960 graduate of SUNY Downstate's College of Medicine, and a recipient of a SUNY honorary Doctor of Science degree and a Distinguished Alumni Award. Dr. Paul's contributions to medicine, science, and public health will be long remembered. We extend our deepest sympathies to his family, colleagues, and friends. Carlos N. Pato, MD Dean, College of Medicine John F. Williams, MD, EdD, MPH President
docs.snippet: PAUL--William E., MD The SUNY Downstate Medical Center community mourns the passing of William E. Paul, MD, chief of the Laboratory of Immunology, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, and former director of the National Institutes...

docs.lead_paragraph: As the director of the Office of AIDS Research at the National Institute of Health, Dr. Paul focused the government’s research programs to develop innovative therapies.

headline.main: Dr. William E. Paul, Who Helped AIDS Research Save Millions of Lives, Dies at 79
headline.print_headline: Dr. William Paul, Who Helped Develop Lifesaving AIDS Therapies, Dies at 79

docs.abstract: Dr William E Paul, an innovative immunologist and director of the Office of AIDS Research at National Institutes of Health, whose research and advocacy provided breakthroughs in treatment of HIV/AIDS that saved millions of lives, dies at age 79.
docs.snippet: As the director of the Office of AIDS Research at the National Institute of Health, Dr. Paul focused the government’s research programs to develop innovative therapies.

docs.lead_paragraph: The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine says immigrants are eager to learn English and are not burdening the health care system.

headline.main: Newest Immigrants Assimilating as Fast as Previous Ones, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Immigrants Fitting In to U.S., Report Says

docs.abstract: Report by National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine finds most recent generations of immigrants are settling into American society as rapidly and broadly as earlier ones; report examined 41 million foreign-born residents, including about 11.3 million illegal immigrants, along with roughly 37 million children born to them in country.
docs.snippet: The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine says immigrants are eager to learn English and are not burdening the health care system.
